reviews.review_msg: Anthony cares about his students' success but the class is brutally tedious. Weekly readings, blog posts, assignments, written critiques, and the two presentations demand both feedback and group essays. There's a ton of homework, but it's not hard. The semester ended a month ago, and we still only have marks for part 1 of the first assignment.

He is a great prof! The class on the other hand is rather unnecessary. Slow start to the class but at the end you end up with a lot of assignments. He doesn't like marking anything for some reason though. A week before the finals for other classes and he has released one memo we wrote in the second week of class.
Made lectures engaging in an online environment. Something most profs failed at. Discussion based case analysis every week. Easily the best strategy course.
